There was speculation during September and early October 2007 about whether Brown would call a snap general election.
Brown announced on 6 October that there would be no election any time soon â€“ despite opinion polls showing that he was capable of winning an election should he call one.
This proved to be a costly mistake, as during 2008 his party slid behind the Conservatives (led by David Cameron) in the polls.
In July 2008, he supported a new bill extending the pre-charge detention period to 42 days.

quotes: He proposed moving some traditional prime ministerial powers conferred by royal prerogative to the realm of Parliament, such as the power to declare war and approve appointments to senior positions.

quotes: He asserted that the attorney general should not have the right to decide whether to prosecute in individual cases, such as in the loans for peerages scandal.
